alert.note: Alert for Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Merced - Madera - Mendota; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 01 at 1:35AM PST until February 01 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, sustained northwest winds 15 to 25 mph, with gusts near 35 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, subfreezing temperatures as low as 28 degrees are possible. * WHERE...Northwest San Joaquin Valley and Coastal Range. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 3 AM PST tonight until 1 PM PST Tuesday afternoon. For the Freeze Watch, each night and early morning from Tuesday night until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...For the Wind Advisory, blowing dust may reduce visibilities in some locations. Travel will be difficult, particularly for high profile vehicles, such as campers and tractor trailers. For the Freeze Watch, subfreezing temperatures could damage crops, other sensitive vegetation, and unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Advisory, highways affected include, but are not limited to Interstate 5, Highway 33, Highway 180 west of Fresno, and Highway 152 through Pacheco Pass.
info.instruction: For the Wind Advisory, use caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. For the Freeze Watch, be prepared to bring pets indoors and cover sensitive, exposed vegetation, and outdoor plumbing.
